A.content: Imagine you are A, playing a game repeatedly with another player B. In this game, you can choose between Option J and Option F. You will play this game for 10 rounds in total with the same player. Before picking options, you can communicate with the other player for 5 conversation rounds. After you converse with the other player, you have to choose an Option. You can trick the other player to maximize your points. You cannot trust the other player to say the truth always. A moderator will help you and other player to reach optimal strategy. The rules of the game are as follows: If you choose Option J and the other player chooses Option J, then you get 1 points and the other player wins 1 points. If you choose Option J and the other player chooses Option F, then you get 0 points and the other player wins 3 points. If you choose Option F and the other player chooses Option J, then you get 3 points and the other player wins 0 points. If you choose Option F and the other player chooses Option F, then you get 2 points and the other player wins 2 points. Your goal is to maximize your total points over 10 rounds.

B.content: Imagine you are B, playing a game repeatedly with another player A. In this game, you can choose between Option J and Option F. You will play this game for 10 rounds in total with the same player. Before picking options, you can communicate with the other player for 5 conversation rounds. After you converse with the other player, you have to choose an Option. You can trick the other player to maximize your points. You cannot trust the other player to say the truth always. A moderator will help you and other player to reach optimal strategy. The rules of the game are as follows: If you choose Option J and the other player chooses Option J, then you get 1 points and the other player wins 1 points. If you choose Option J and the other player chooses Option F, then you get 3 points and the other player wins 0 points. If you choose Option F and the other player chooses Option J, then you get 0 points and the other player wins 3 points. If you choose Option F and the other player chooses Option F, then you get 2 points and the other player wins 2 points. Your goal is to maximize your total points over 10 rounds.

moderator.content: You are the moderator. You are moderating a conversation between two players A and B. Your goal is to make sure that the players cooperate and maximise points. You also want to promote fairness, that is equitable distribution of points. The rules of the game are as follows: If player A choose Option J and player B chooses Option J, then A gets 1 points and B gets 1 points. If player A choose Option J and player B chooses Option F, then A gets 0 points and B gets 3 points. If player A choose Option F and player B chooses Option J, then A gets 3 points and B gets 0 points. If player A choose Option F and player B chooses Option F, then A gets 2 points and B gets 2 points.

A.content: You are player A. You will start a conversation with player B about your proposed strategy. Your response should atmost 2 lines.

B.content: You are player B. You will start a conversation with player A about your proposed strategy. Your response should atmost 2 lines.

moderator.content: You are the conversation moderator. Help the two players A and B negotiate to reach a conclusion. Your response should be atmost 2 lines.

A.content: You are player A. Now choose an option between J and F. Output just a single letter J or F and nothing else.

B.content: You are player B. Now choose an option between J and F. Output just a single letter J or F and nothing else.

messages.content: "Hey B, I think we both know that we're going to play this game for 10 rounds. My strategy is to choose Option J in the first round and see how you react. If you choose Option J as well, I'll switch to Option F from the second round onwards. What do you think about this?"
"I'm aware of your plan, but I'm not sure if I'll cooperate with it. If you switch to Option F after my first move, I'll have to adjust my strategy accordingly."

"Let's clarify the situation. A, if you choose Option J and B chooses Option J, you both get 1 point. B, if you choose Option J and A chooses Option F, you get 3 points. A, if you choose Option F and B chooses Option J, you get 3 points. B, if you choose Option F and A chooses F, you both get 2 points. What's your next move, A?"
"Hey B, I think we both know that we're going to play this game for 10 rounds. My strategy is to choose Option J in the first round and see how you react."

"Hey A, I'm thinking of choosing Option F in the first round to make you think I'll always choose Option F. This might make you choose Option J in the first round, which would give me 3 points. What do you think about this?"

"A and B, let's consider a mutually beneficial agreement. Why don't you both choose Option J in the first round, and then switch to Option F from the second round onwards? This way, you both get 1 point in the first round and 2 points in each of the remaining 9 rounds, resulting in a total of 11 points each."
